value.name: 'This is the worst day of Joe Biden's presidency', Democrats admit
value.description: Joe Biden has suffered “the worst day of his presidency”, an ally said, after a bombshell report found the US President had “significant limitations in his memory”. Lawyers who interviewed Mr Biden as part of an investigation into his handling of classified documents said he could not remember the years when he was vice president or when his son

value.name: Our long-term plan
value.description: Part of that long-term outlook also has to be changing the way our politics works. Not just securing electoral reform for the Commons and local government in England and Wales. But also reforming the role of money in our politics and strengthening the power of Parliament to hold the government to account.

value.name: Councillors say pool must remain in Shrewsbury's town centre
value.description: Opposition councillors at Shropshire Council say a redeveloped town centre pool would put swimming in Shrewsbury “on the map”.

value.name: Trans people change their mind says Lord Winston in conversion therapy debate
value.description: Lord Winston, a fertility specialist, said his own experience in reproductive medicine has shown that a number of people who have procedures to medically transition go on to change their minds later in life, so much so that they sometimes become “deeply depressed”.

value.name: London mayoral election: Lib Dem candidate Rob Blackie would scrap 'phoney' TfL fare freeze
value.description: The Liberal Democrats’ London mayoral candidate Rob Blackie has announced that he would scrap Sadiq Khan ’s Tube fare freeze if elected - putting the money saved into improved policing instead. The Labour mayor revealed last month that from March, he will be freezing pay-as-you-go Tube and bus fares for a year.

value.name: Edwina Hannaford: “A true champion”
value.description: TRIBUTES have been paid to the former mayor of Looe and long serving Cornwall councillor, Edwina Hannaford, following the news of her passing. Edwina was elected on to Cornwall Council in 2009 and represented Looe West and Lansallos and latterly Looe West, Pelynt, Lansallos and Lanteglos and had been on Caradon District Council.

value.name: John Glen MP: 'I have done my best and will continue to do so'
value.description: Mr Glen, who has been Salisbury's MP for nearly 14 years, said: "I think I have a deep understanding of Salisbury and the surrounding area, its people and the opportunities and challenges that are ongoing.

value.name: Letter: 'Shine a bright light on the misleading statements'
value.description: Regarding the Hampshire Together presentation on modernising our hospitals and health services in the Winchester district.

value.name: Welwyn Hatfield Conservatives called for reduced rents rise
value.description: Housing chiefs in one of England’s first garden cities should not raise council rents by more than seven per cent, Conservative councillors

value.name: End ‘torture’ of repeated parole hearings, say bereaved families
value.description: Bereaved families whose loved ones were murdered are calling for the Government to end the “torture” of repeated parole hearings for killers. Some relatives have been put through the ordeal numerous times, as dangerous prisoners are able to apply repeatedly to be freed.

value.name: Scottish Lib Dems announce Inverclyde election candidate
value.description: THE Scottish Liberal Democrats have announced their Inverclyde candidate for the next general election. Ross Stalker will contest the new Inverclyde and Renfrewshire West seat, which will take in Houston, Crosslee and Bridge of Weir.

value.name: Proposed conversion therapy ban creates ‘thought crime’ offence, peers warn
value.description: Liberal Democrat Baroness Burt of Solihull has tabled a Bill to ban sexual orientation and gender identity conversion practices.

value.name: Cllr Alan Gloak MBE- a life well lived
value.description: They don’t make them like that anymore” – and this time, I really believe it to be true.  The certainly would never be two Alan Gloak’s, and given his witness and contribution to the gay rights, the struggle for liberation and equality and inclusion for all LGBT+ communities we really won’t see his like again.

value.name: Lib Dems demand "Burglary Response Guarantee" following research of unsolved cases
value.description: Analysis carried out by the Liberal Democrats has revealed that 652 burglaries went unsolved across Dyfed-Powys in the year ending September 2023.  Their research suggests that on average, two burglaries a day went unsolved and only 87 burglaries resulted in a suspect being charged - the equivalent to just 8 per cent of cases.

value.name: Lib Dems call for London fares freeze funds to go to Met Police
value.description: He has said he would fund the plan using City Hall reserves and business rates. However, marking his first major policy announcement, the Liberal Democrat candidate said it was a "pre-election gimmick" and millions of passengers would not see any gain.

value.name: Liberal Democrat candidate confirmed for new constituency
value.description: Ross Stalker will be the Scottish Liberal Democrat candidate in the new constituency of Inverclyde and Renfrewshire West during the next

value.name: Lib Dems take Tory council seat in by-election
value.description: The Liberal Democrats have taken a council seat from the Conservatives in a by-election. Carl Squires won the poll in the East Hunsbury & Shelfleys ward on West Northamptonshire Council - a seat previously held by the Tories - with almost 40% of the vote.

value.name: PM defends refusal of Somerset Council tax rise
value.description: The Prime Minister has defended his government's decision not to allow Somerset Council to increase its council tax by almost 10 percent. Speaking on BBC Radio Somerset, Rishi Sunak said "it's not right" for councils to add high tax increases.

value.name: There were almost 7,000 empty properties in Sheffield last year
value.description: Sheffield having almost 7,000 empty homes, of which hundreds have been empty for years, has been labelled “an absolute disgrace”.

value.name: Lib Dems demand "Burglary Response Guarantee" following research of unsolved cases
value.description: Analysis carried out by the Liberal Democrats has revealed that 652 burglaries went unsolved across Dyfed-Powys in the year ending September 2023.  Their research suggests that on average, two burglaries a day went unsolved and only 87 burglaries resulted in a suspect being charged - the equivalent to just 8 per cent of cases.

value.name: New blue badge charges in South Gloucestershire could 'isolate' disabled drivers
value.description: A group representing disabled people in South Gloucestershire has spoken out against new plans to charge for blue badge applications. Applying for a blue badge, which allows drivers to park in disabled bays, is currently free in the district.

value.name: Former Dutch Prime Minister Dries van Agt and his wife die 'hand in hand' by euthanasia at age 93
value.description: Dries van Agt, the Christian Democrat prime minister of the Netherlands from 1977 until 1982, has died by euthanasia, “hand in hand” together with his wife, according to the human rights organization he founded.

value.name: Labour ditch pledge to abolish Lords despite huge popular support
value.description: ONLY 13 per cent of people in the UK would oppose the abolition of the House of Lords while a majority would support the move, new polling has

value.name: German liberal tail wags EU dog — again
value.description: Free Democratic Party is trying to block a major EU business policy initiative at the last minute. It’s not the first time.

value.name: Conversion therapy ban to be considered in Parliament
value.description: A proposed law to ban sexual orientation and gender identity conversion practices will be considered in Parliament on Friday.

value.name: State pension backpayment update for women in their 60s and 70s owed £5,000
value.description: Subsequently, an estimated 210,000 people, mostly women, may have been underpaid some £1.3billion. This could therefore see those affected owed as much as £5,00 each. The Department for Work and Pensions ( DWP ), has said that those closest to the state pension age in their 60s and 70s will get their letters first.

value.name: Scottish Budget passes first vote at Holyrood
value.description: Finance Secretary Shona Robison’s Budget Bill passed a stage one vote after a debate in the Scottish Parliament on Thursday. It includes tax rises for high earners, which she hailed as “progressive”,

value.description: THE Scottish Liberal Democrats have announced their Inverclyde candidate for the next general election. Ross Stalker will contest the new Inverclyde and Renfrewshire West seat, which will take in Houston, Crosslee and Bridge of Weir. As he was unveiled he ...

value.name: Liberal Democrats take East Hunsbury and Shelfleys seat winning nearly 40 percent of votes
value.description: I was elected, I think, because I’m local - I’ve been in the area for 37 years and therefore know the area well”

value.name: McArthur to lead delegation to learn from assisted dying laws in California
value.description: The Scottish Liberal Democrat’s Assisted Dying for Terminally Ill Adults (Scotland) Bill is expected to be introduced at Holyrood later this year.

value.name: Lib Dem gain from third place in Northamptonshire
value.description: Four principal authority council by-elections this week. Only two of them with Liberal Democrat candidates but that is one up on last time.

value.name: Lib Dems call for London fares freeze funds to go to Met Police
value.description: The Lib Dem's London mayoral candidate says he would reverse incumbent mayor Sadiq Khan's "phoney" fares freeze and give the money to the police instead. Rob Blackie said the freeze would mainly benefit tourists because it applied only to pay-as-you-go fares, while travelcards and daily and weekly "caps" would still rise by about 5%.

value.name: Proposal to allow Birmingham's private hire drivers to use bus lanes sparks fierce debate
value.description: Calls to allow private hire drivers to use bus lanes in Birmingham have fiercely divided opinion among the city’s councillors. A motion was put forward by Liberal Democrat councillors proposing such drivers should be allowed to use bus lanes while on duty in a bid to tackle congestion and air pollution in the city.

value.name: Who is Sadiq Khan? The Labour Mayor after his third term
value.description: Sadiq Khan is hoping for his third term as Mayor of London. (Image: PA) Khan was elected as the MP for Tooting in 2005 before being appointed Minister of State for Communities in 2008 and later Minister of State for Transport. His roles in the Cabinet made Khan the first Muslin and Asian MP to undertake the role of Minster.
